{{coord|53.4032|-2.5734|type:landmark_region:GB|display=inline|name=A574 road (southwestern end)}} |direction_b= |terminus_b = Butts Bridge, Leigh (A572)
{{coord|53.4921|-2.4991|type:landmark_region:GB|display=inline|name=A574 road (northeastern end)}} |junction = {{ukmotorwaysmall|62}}
{{ukroadsmall-svg|57}}
{{ukroadsmall-svg|49}}
{{ukroadsmall-svg|50}}
{{ukroadsmall|580}} |destinations= }} The '''A574''' is a road in [[England]], running through the borough of [[Warrington]] before terminating at the end of Butts Bridge in [[Leigh, Greater Manchester|Leigh]]. The route covers a distance of approximately {{convert|13|mi}}The AA Route Planner and links Warrington town centre with the outer suburbs of Birchwood and Sankey. The road passes through the following districts of Warrington and Leigh (in route order): *[[Great Sankey|Sankey Bridges]] (Start of route) *[[Old Hall]] *[[Westbrook, Warrington|Westbrook]] *[[Callands]] *[[Longford, Warrington|Longford]] *[[Orford, Warrington|Orford]] *[[Padgate]] *[[Longbarn]] *[[Birchwood]] *Locking Stumps *[[Risley, Warrington|Risley]] *[[Culcheth]] *[[Glazebury]] *[[Hope Carr]] (End of route) Being in the new part of Warrington, the road is renowned for its numerous roundabouts[http://www.sabre-roads.org.uk/roadlists/r10/notes.php?number=A574 Society for All British Road Enthusiasts, A574 route description]—26 in all,Count of roundabouts on the A574, using maps at Multimap the first one less than {{convert|1/2|mi|km}} from the start and the last about {{convert|1|mi}} from the terminus.A-Z Warrington and district 1998 Edition (pgs 12/13) ==References== {{GeoGroupTemplate}} {{GB A road zone 5}} {{coord|53.4452|-2.5230|dim:10000_region:GB|display=title|name=A574 road}} {{DEFAULTSORT:5-0574}} [[Category:Roads in England]] [[Category:Roads in Cheshire]] [[Category:Roads in Greater Manchester]] {{England-road-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox scientist | name = Alain Berton | native_name = | native_name_lang = | image = Alain Berton en 1946.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Alain Berton in 1946 | birth_date = <!--{{birth date |1912|MM|DD}}--> | birth_place = | death_date = <!--{{death date and age ||MM|DD |1979|MM|DD}} (death date then birth date)--> | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = <!--{{coord|LAT|LONG|type:landmark|display=inline,title}}--> | other_names = | residence = | citizenship = | nationality = French | fields = Chemistry | workplaces = | patrons = | education = | alma_mater = | thesis_title = <!--(or | thesis1_title = and | thesis2_title = )--> | thesis_url = <!--(or | thesis1_url = and | thesis2_url = )--> | thesis_year = <!--(or | thesis1_year = and | thesis2_year = )--> | doctoral_advisor = <!--(or | doctoral_advisors = )--> | academic_advisors = | doctoral_students = | notable_students = | known_for = | influences = | influenced = | awards = | author_abbrev_bot = | author_abbrev_zoo = | spouse = <!--(or | spouses = )--> | partner = <!--(or | partners = )--> | children = | signature = <!--(filename only)--> | signature_alt = | website = <!--{{URL|www.example.com}}--> | footnotes = }}
'''Alain-Edgard Berton''' (1912-1979) was a French chemical engineer who specialized in [[toxicology]] and in the analysis of air components in industrial environments. In the late 1950s he invented the "Osmopile",<ref>Google books, ''Chimie & industrie'', Volume 86, Camille Matignon, Société de chimie industrielle, 1961 [https://books.google.fr/books?ei=9g-ZVa7uHojdUdfYkNgM&hl=fr&id=hgYkAQAAMAAJ&dq=%22Alain+Berton%22+nous+a+quitt%C3%A9&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=%22Alain+Berton%22+]</ref> a measuring device, dubbed "the first artificial nose," which initiated, through the use of highly sensitive galvanic cells, the [[electrochemistry|electrochemical]] analysis of air to detect dangerous components.
== Biography == Alain Berton was born in [[Coro Coro, Bolivia|Coro Coro]] [[Coro Coro, Bolivia| ]] in [[Bolivia]] on 27 August 1912.<ref>Google books [https://books.google.fr/books?hl=fr&id=qBkMAQAAMAAJ&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=%22Berton+%28Alain%29%22 ''Who is Who in France''].</ref> He was the son of Adrien Berton, a mining engineer, and Justine Rodriguez. He was educated at the [[Lycée Hoche]] in [[Versailles (city)|Versailles]], and became a chemical engineer at [[Chimie ParisTech|the Chemical Institute of the University of Paris]] in 1933.<ref>Paul Lebeau, ''Les hautes températures et leurs utilisations en chimie Publisher'', Masson et Cie, year 1950, volume 1 Google books [https://books.google.fr/books?hl=fr&id=SF3VAAAAMAAJ&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=%22Alain+Berton%2C+Ing%C3%A9nieur+Chimiste+de+l%27Institut+de+Chimie+de+l%27Universit%C3%A9+de+Paris%22 ]</ref><ref name="PL">Paul Lebeau, [https://books.google.fr/books?hl=fr&id=SF3VAAAAMAAJ&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=%22Ramsay%22 ''Les hautes températures et leurs utilisations en chimie''], vol. I, Masson et Cie, 1950, page xxviii.</ref> From 1935 to 1937 he was a [[William Ramsay|Ramsay Fellow]] at the [[Institute of Technology]] in London, in the laboratory of Prof. [[William Lawrence Bragg]], at the [[Royal Institution]]. He began his career in 1938 at the [[Centre national de la recherche scientifique|French National Centre for Scientific Research]] as a "boursier" (fellow) in [[Georges Urbain]]'s laboratory (dedicated to war chemical studies, protection against poison gas).<ref>[https://books.google.fr/books?id=psDQAAAAMAAJ&q=%22Alain+Berton+%22&dq=%22Alain+Berton+%22&hl=fr&sa=X&ei=D1uYVemAMsnbUdnxpegN&ved=0CFAQ6AEwBw ''Chimie analytique'', Volume 47, Partie 1].</ref><ref>Gallica bnf [http://gallica.bnf.fr/Search?ArianeWireIndex=index&p=1&lang=FR&q=%22Alain+Berton%22 ''Comptes rendus de l'Académie des Sciences''].</ref> Following Georges Urbain's death that same year, he was assigned to [[Paul Lebeau]]'s laboratory as "chargé de recherche" (researcher).<ref>Paul Lebeau, ''Les hautes températures et leurs utilisations en chimie'', vol. I, Masson et Cie, 1950, page xxviii.</ref> From 1959 till 1969 he was head of research.<ref>Persée.fr [http://www.persee.fr/web/revues/home/prescript/article/psy_0003-5033_1963_num_63_2_27789 Détection olfactive et détection physique des vapeurs odorantes, Guilot, Berton, 1963].</ref> In parallel, from 1959 to 1978, he was head of the Toxicology Laboratory for the Regional Social Security Fund in Paris.
== The Osmopile == By the end of the [[World War II|war]] in 1944, post war recovery started: Alain Berton's work on the application of [[Absorption spectroscopy|absorption and emission spectroscopy]] in the [[ultraviolet]] and [[infrared]],<ref>Worlcatalog [http://www.worldcat.org/title/spectres-dabsorption-par-reflexion-de-substances-en-poudre-dans-le-visible-et-lultraviolet/oclc/016728836 Spectres d’absorption par réflexion de substances en poudre, dans le visible et l’ultraviolet]?</ref> and within the frame of concerns about labor force protection, the specific dosage of atmospheric pollutants became of vital interest in factories to effectively detect and remedy industrial pollution. Thus, in the 1950s, based on the method of [[gas chromatography]] analysis by low temperature followed by [[pyrolysis]], he managed to isolate chlorinated substances and acid vapors components in the air. He was able to individualize traces of gas and vapors by using ultra-sensitive galvanic batteries and galvanic microcell detectors.<ref>Gallica [http://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/bpt6k3185k/f650.image.r=alain%20berton.langFR Spectrochimie].</ref> He presented his research in the preamble to the convention of the [[Analytical Chemistry]] Group in 1958.<ref>Google Scholar [https://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=%22Alain+Berton+%22&btnG=&hl=en&as_sdt=0%2C5 citations].</ref><ref>Google books [https://books.google.fr/books?id=YavPAAAAMAAJ&pg=RA1-PA48&dq=%22Alain+Berton+%22&hl=fr&sa=X&ei=D1uYVemAMsnbUdnxpegN&ved=0CEsQ6AEwBg#v=onepage&q=%22Alain%20Berton%20%22&f=false Un photomètre ultra sensible].</ref> Alain Berton named his invention "the Osmopile," later nicknamed "the sniffing cells" by the [[scientific journal]] ''Atomes''.<ref>Les osmopiles, les piles qui sentent, ''Atomes, la revue d’information et de culture scientifique générale'', numéro 192, novembre 1962 [http://sciences.gloubik.info/spip.php?article422].</ref> The first "artificial nose" was thus born. His invention was adopted and developed in the US<ref>"The Chemical-Senses" by Moncrieff, publisher Hill, edition 3, 1967 [https://books.google.fr/books?ei=TGmXVdKtIsviUabimzg&id=B-5qAAAAMAAJ&dq=%22Berton%22%2B%22osmopile%22&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=%22Berton%22].</ref> and went around the world with a report from the [[Associated Press]] dated December 8, 1958.
Berton’s Osmopile was marketed by Jouan, a laboratory equipment manufacturer founded in the 1940s by a researcher from the [[Pasteur Institute]] and acquired in 2003 by [[Thermo Electron]].<ref>[http://www.lesechos.fr/24/09/2003/LesEchos/18995-128-ECH_jouan-rachete-par-son-concurrent-americain-thermo-electron.htm Les Echos]</ref> The Osmopile device was modernized over time and used in the fight against industrial [[pollution]].
Through his invention, Alain Berton proved to be an [[Political ecology|ecology pioneer]].<ref>Gallica [http://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/bpt6k61239179/f279.image.r=osmopile.langEN ''Annales de la Société Entomologique de France''].</ref><ref>Gallica [http://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/bpt6k5673563j/f89.image.r=osmopile.langEN ''Comptes rendus de séances de l’Académie des Sciences'', 1982].</ref><ref>Catalogue BNF [http://catalogue.bnf.fr/servlet/RechercheEquation?TexteCollection=HGARSTUVWXYZ1DIECBMJNQLOKP&TexteTypeDoc=DESNFPIBTMCJOV&Equation=IDP%3Dcb33876738p&FormatAffichage=0&host=catalogue Extrait de ''Chimie analytique'', N° 3, mars 1957, Commissariat à l’énergie atomique et aux énergies alternatives (France)].</ref>
== Patents == * Berton, Alain Edgard : ''Montre-bracelet-réveil tactile''. 5 décembre 1949 : FR953313-A <ref>[http://worldwide.espacenet.com/publicationDetails/biblio?CC=FR&NR=953313 Espacenet Publication details]</ref> * Berton Alain Edgard : ''Photomètre infrarouge utilisable en analyse physique et chimique''. 24 janvier 1955 : FR1084823-A<ref>[http://worldwide.espacenet.com/publicationDetails/biblio;jsessionid=t-NCpxOJdQsdIZ6mfvCo+0FI.espacenet_levelx_prod_2?locale=fr_EP&CC=FR&NR=1084823 Espacenet Publication details]</ref> * Berton Alain: ''Photomètre simple ultraviolet, avec enregistreur photographique à lecture instantanée, utilisable en analyse physique et chimique''. 27 juin 1958 : FR1159401-A <ref>[http://worldwide.espacenet.com/publicationDetails/biblio?CC=FR&NR=1159401 Espacenet Publication details]</ref> * Berton Alain : ''Apparatus for detecting and measuring traces of impurities in a gas''. 16 juin 1960 : FR1223277-A ; idem, 27 juin 1960 : FR1224831-A<ref>[http://worldwide.espacenet.com/publicationDetails/biblio?CC=FR&NR=1224831 Espacenet Publication details]</ref> * Berton Alain : ''Dispositif chimique d'enregistrement sans contact''. 14 octobre 1960 : FR1234235-A<ref name="Espacenet Publication details">[http://worldwide.espacenet.com/publicationDetails/biblio?CC=FR&NR=1300917 Espacenet Publication details]</ref> * Berton Alain : ''Analyseur colorimétrique de vapeurs, portatif''. 17 mars 1961 : FR1255988-A<ref>[http://worldwide.espacenet.com/publicationDetails/biblio?CC=FR&NR=1255988 Espacenet Publication details]</ref> * Berton Alain : ''Dispositif électrochimique de détection d'impuretés dans les gaz''. 10 août 1962 : FR1300917-A<ref name="Espacenet Publication details"/>
== Award == Alain Berton was awarded the Medal of the International Bureau of Analytical Chemistry (BICA)- International fight against chemical weapons. led by [[:fr:Paul Nicolardot]].
== See also == * [[Thermal decomposition]] * [[Enthalpy]]
== Notes and references == {{reflist|30em}} The information on this page is partially translated from the equivalent page in French [[:fr:Alain Berton (Chimiste)]] licensed under the Creative Commons/Attribution Sharealike [https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/]. History of contributions can be checked here:[https://fr.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Alain_Berton_%28chimiste%29&action=history] {{Portal bar|Biography|Science|}} {{Authority control}}

= {{url|www.airca.org}} }}
The '''Association of International Research and Development Centers for Agriculture (AIRCA)''' is an international, non-profit alliance focused on increasing [[food security]] by supporting smallholder agriculture and rural enterprise within healthy, sustainable and climate-smart landscapes.<ref>{{cite journal|date=October 2013|title=WHITE PAPER Transforming rural livelihoods and landscapes: sustainable improvements to incomes, food security and the environment|url=http://www.airca.org/docs/AIRCA_White_Paper_Landscapes.pdf|format=PDF|publisher=Association of International Research and Development Centers for Agriculture|isbn=978-92-95098-31-2|author1=Nicholls T.|author2=Elouafi, I.|author3=Borgemeister, C.|author4=Campos-Arce, J.J.|author5=Hermann, M.|author6=Hoogendoorn, J.|author7=Keatinge, J.D.H.|author8=Kelemu, S.|author9=Molden, D.J.|author10=Roy, A.|display-authors=3}}</ref>
== Overview and focus == AIRCA unites nine international [[agricultural research]] and development centers which focus on a diverse mix of commodities, crops and issues including tropical agriculture, vegetable production, bamboo and rattan, insect pests, fertilizer use, underutilized crops, biosaline agriculture and sustainable development in mountains.<ref name=":0">{{cite web|url=http://www.greenink.co.uk/sites/default/documents/newsletters/new_leaf_february_14_full.html#article6|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140728133806/http://www.greenink.co.uk/sites/default/documents/newsletters/new_leaf_february_14_full.html#article6|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2014-07-28|title=New Leaf - Birth of a research association|date=February 2014|publisher=Green Ink|accessdate=2016-04-19}}</ref>
The members of AIRCA address sustainable agriculture and the environment at the [[Landscape ecology|landscape]] level. The centers create solutions that take into account the diversity of interactions among people and the environment, agricultural and non-agricultural systems, the crossing of national boundaries and other factors that represent the entire context of agriculture.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gfar.net/news/healthy-soil-foundation-healthy-people-and-landscapes|title=Healthy soil: the foundation for healthy people and landscapes|website=GFAR - The Global Forum on Agricultural Research|access-date=2016-04-19}}</ref>
AIRCA members serve more than 60 countries comprising over 70% of the world’s population from across the Americas, Africa and the Asia-Pacific region.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.landscapes.org/a-new-alliance-with-a-focus-on-sustainable-landscapes/|title=A new alliance with a focus on sustainable landscapes - Global Landscapes Forum|website=Global Landscapes Forum|language=en-US|access-date=2016-04-19}}</ref> The broad alliance has collective access to a wide variety of crops and ecosystems.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.scidev.net/global/biodiversity/news/global-alliance-to-strengthen-research-farmer-links.html|title=Global alliance to strengthen research–farmer links|last=|website=SciDev.Net|access-date=2016-04-19}}</ref>
The combined resources of AIRCA can be used to achieve 10 of the 17 [[Sustainable Development Goals]] (SDGs) established by the United Nations in 2015.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/sustainable-development-goals/|title=Sustainable development goals - United Nations|website=United Nations Sustainable Development|language=en-US|access-date=2016-04-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.airca.org/index.php/airca-resources/airca-s-response-to-the-sdgs|title=How AIRCA can help to achieve SDGs|website=AIRCA|access-date=2016-04-19}}</ref>
== Relationship to CGIAR and FAO == AIRCA member organizations work with crops of high economic, social, nutritional and ecological value. This complements and contrasts with the work of the [[Food and Agriculture Organization]] (FAO) and the [[CGIAR]] who work primarily in staple crops.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fao.org/docs/eims/upload/305922/Session%20Brief%20P2-2%20AIRCA-DO.pdf|title=Second Global Conference on Agricultural Research for Development - Breakout sessions P2.2 Land, Water, Forests and Landscapes - Speaker Brief|last2=Nichols|first2=Trevor|date=|publisher=[[Food and Agriculture Organization]]|first1=Sarah|last1=Simons|accessdate=2014-07-24}}</ref>
AIRCA does have some overlap with the CGIAR, however the CGIAR generally focuses more on agricultural research while AIRCA has more of a concentration on the implementation of agricultural research and [[development communication]].<ref name="ramakrishna1" /> AIRCA has a strong orientation toward problem solving at a system level, rather than a focus on a single commodity.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.gfar.net/newsletters/fri-30032012-0244|title=New association to foster work of international agricultural research centers|website=GFAR - The Global Forum on Agricultural Research|access-date=2016-04-19}}</ref>
== History == AIRCA was launched on 2 March 2012 at the headquarters of the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) in Rome, Italy.<ref name=":1" />
It was publicly presented in Punta del Este, Uruguay, on 30 October 2012 during the second [[Global Forum on Agricultural Research|Global Conference on Agricultural Research for Development]].<ref name="ramakrishna1">{{cite news|first=Akkinapally |last=Ramakrishna |url=http://www.nari.org.pg/node/228 |title=Strengthening research–farmer links in developing countries |publisher=Nari.org.pg |date=2012-11-27 |accessdate=2014-07-24}}</ref>
== Members == {| class="wikitable sortable" |+{{As of|March 2016}} the members of AIRCA are:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.airca.org/index.php/airca-members |title=AIRCA Centers |publisher=Airca.org |accessdate=2016-03-10}}</ref> !Member Name and Overview !Acronym !Headquarters Location |- |'''[[World Vegetable Center]]''' ''Previously "Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center".'' Alleviation of poverty and malnutrition in the developing world through the increased production and consumption of safe vegetables. |AVRDC |[[Shanhua District|Shanhua, Taiwan]] |- |'''[[CAB International]]''' ''Previously "Commonwealth Agricultural Bureaux".'' Improves people’s lives by providing information and applying scientific expertise to solve problems in agriculture and the environment. |CABI |[[Wallingford, Oxfordshire|Wallingford]], England, United Kingdom |- |'''[[Centro Agronómico Tropical de Investigación y Enseñanza]]''' Contributes to rural poverty reduction by promoting competitive and sustainable agriculture and natural resource management, through higher education, research and technical cooperation. |CATIE |[[Turrialba|Turrialba, Costa Rica]] |- |'''Crops for the Future''' Helps partners to generate, synthesise and promote knowledge on neglected and underutilised crops for the benefit of the poor and agricultural sustainability. |CFF |[[Kuala Lumpur|Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia]] |- |'''[[International Center for Biosaline Agriculture]]''' Enables water short countries to improve their agricultural productivity, social equity and environmental sustainability through the effective use of marginal quality water. |ICBA |[[Dubai|Dubai, United Arab Emirates]] |- |'''[[International Centre for Integrated Mountain Development]]''' Enables and facilitates the equitable and sustainable well-being of the people of the Hindu Kush-Himalayas by supporting sustainable mountain development through active regional cooperation. |ICIMOD |[[Kathmandu|Kathmandu, Nepal]] |- |'''[[International Centre of Insect Physiology and Ecology]]''' Helps alleviate poverty, ensure food security and improve the overall health status of peoples of the tropics by developing and extending management tools and strategies for harmful and useful arthropods, while preserving the natural resource base through research and capacity building. |ICIPE |[[Nairobi|Nairobi, Kenya]] |- |'''[[International Fertilizer Development Center]]''' Enables smallholder farmers in developing countries to increase agricultural productivity, generate economic growth and practice environmental stewardship by enhancing their ability to manage mineral and organic fertilizers responsibly and participate profitably in input and output markets. |IFDC |[[Muscle Shoals, Alabama|Muscle Shoals, Alabama, United States]] |- |'''[[International Network for Bamboo and Rattan]]''' Improves the wellbeing of the producers and users of bamboo and rattan within the context of a sustainable bamboo and rattan resource base |INBAR |[[Beijing|Beijing, China]] |}
